hero.subtitle: Physics and Math @ Yale University
hero.description: I'm a senior studying Physics (intensive) and Math at Yale!

about.title: About Me
paragraphs: I am a senior at Yale University pursuing a B.S. in Intensive Physics and Mathematics.
I also spent a year studying at the Inter-University Center for Japanese Language Studies (IUC) in Yokohama and hold JLPT N1 certification.
Outside of academics, my interests include piano, Japanese literature, and puzzle hunts. I grew up in a farm-like environment in Arkansas and love animals. Please feel free to reach out anytime!

items.degree: B.S. in Intensive Physics and Mathematics
items.courses: Abstract Algebra, Probability Theory, Analysis in Function Spaces, Vector Analysis and Manifolds, Discrete Mathematics, Analysis I and II, Ordinary Differential Equations, Multivariable Calculus, Linear Algebra, Mathematical Methods of Physics, Thermodynamics, Quantum Mechanics I and II, Electromagnetism, Classical Mechanics, Modern Physical Measurement I and II (lab), Advanced Physics Lab
items.awards: Sigma Pi Sigma Physics Honor Society (Top third of Yale physics undergraduates by grades)

items.school: Stanford Inter-University Center for Japanese Language Studies (IUC)

items.title: Quantitative Research Intern
items.description: Support quantitative research and investment analysis focused on small-cap Japanese equities. Refine existing machine learning models to assess bankruptcy risk, improving investment decision accuracy. Participate in daily academic finance seminars led by firm partners.

items.title: Summer Research Student
items.description: Determined temperature conditions and shaping amplifier settings to optimize the resolution of NaI and CeBr3 gamma-ray scintillation detectors. Used CERN ROOT to analyze 60Co and 137Cs gamma spectra.

items.title: Summer Undergraduate Research Fellow (SURF)
items.company: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
items.description: Worked with NIST scientists to assess the materials compatibility of various substrates with acidic carrier solutions to make standard imaging phantoms for autoradiography.

items.title: Japanese Teaching Fellow
items.description: Lead weekly hour-long clinics for 16 students in Japanese language courses at Yale. 200+ hours of small-group instruction and tutoring.

items.title: Spatial uniformity and resolution in inkjet-printed 241Am phantoms imaged by digital autoradiography
items.authors: Sean P. Jollota, Denis E. Bergeron, Andrew T. Nupp, et al.
